definition: lit. inviting wealth/We wish you success and riches (cf idiom 招財進寶|招财进宝[zhao1 cai2 jin4 bao3])
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
money/wealth/riches/property/valuables
ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
maneki-neko or "lucky cat", Japanese figurine cat usually found at the entrance of shops, restaurants etc, believed to bring good fortune

sentences.english: Hanging a gourd on the wall next to your front door is thought to bring wealth and fortune.
sentences.chinese: 在大门口旁可以挂上一个葫芦，一般认为可招财纳福。

sentences.english: Us two things on both sides of a life-size statue of lucky boy.
sentences.chinese: 我们面前东西两侧设有两尊真人大小的招财童子立像。

sentences.english: We all hope that this year can wealth.
sentences.chinese: 大家都希望今年能够吉祥如意，招财进宝。

sentences.english: Everyone hopes this year to luck and a thriving business.
sentences.chinese: 大家都希望今年能够吉祥如意，招财进宝。

sentences.english: Ji can live a listen to spittor fortune, he said that he can stay.
sentences.chinese: 纪住一听金蟾能招财，便说他可以留下来了。

sentences.english: Since ancient time, plutus cat has been regarded as a mascot for wealth and luck in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 招财猫自古以来被日本视为招财招福的吉祥物。

sentences.english: Since ancient time, plutus cat has been regarded as a mascot for wealth and luck in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 招财猫自古以来被日本视为招财招福的吉祥物。

sentences.english: Yi could also prove a nice recruiting tool.
sentences.chinese: 易建联还将证明他是个招财进宝的好手。

sentences.english: The feeling of wealth produces wealth.
sentences.chinese: 对富裕的喜爱感将会招财进宝。

sentences.english: Validate the corner to put the money to fortune.
sentences.chinese: 充分验证了墙角放钱能够招财的说法。

sentences.english: Since the shape of the dumplings resembles a gold ingot, eating them symbolizes the gaining of wealth.
sentences.chinese: 由于水饺貌似元宝，食用饺子象征招财进宝。

sentences.english: Zhi Rong cramp, lucky to press the foot suddenly feel strange.
sentences.chinese: 芷蓉脚抽筋，招财为其按脚却突然心感异样。

sentences.english: Maneki-neko is a cat with a raised paw that is displayed to ensure a prosperous business.
sentences.chinese: 招财猫这只小猫总是举着小爪子以示生意兴隆。

definition: ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
mythical animal that brings luck and wards off evil, having head of a dragon and lion's body, often with hoofs, wings and tail/also written 辟邪/fig. valiant soldier
to accept a life of ease/to enjoy a comfortable retirement
god of wealth
maneki-neko or "lucky cat", Japanese figurine cat usually found at the entrance of shops, restaurants etc, believed to bring good fortune
to ward off evil spirits/mythical lion-like animal that wards off evil (also called 貔貅[pi2 xiu1])
to make money
to avoid evil spirits
lucky/auspicious/propitious
god of wealth/very wealthy man
money/wealth/riches/property/valuables
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
citrine (orange or yellow quartz SiO2 as a semiprecious stone)
to alter one's fate/to improve one's luck (e.g. by changing one's name or phone number)
treasure bowl (mythology)/fig. source of wealth/cornucopia/gold mine
misfortune turns to blessing (idiom); to turn an inauspicious start to good account
